text:
<@UPUBAM63X> I found this to be the best course to get someone up to speed on being productive with Rust without getting too stuck with all the drawbacks - it's an entire course from Stanford and really gets into the security and parallelism benefits.
<https://reberhardt.com/cs110l/spring-2020/>
I understand you might not be interested anymore but if you do decide to pick it up again I recommend this.

elements.text: I found this to be the best course to get someone up to speed on being productive with Rust without getting too stuck with all the drawbacks - it's an entire course from Stanford and really gets into the security and parallelism benefits.
I understand you might not be interested anymore but if you do decide to pick it up again I recommend this.
